page.title: 07Industry of Steeple Claydon
page.content: There has been much{change in patterns {of employment}in the village.Prior to W.W.2 the 2 main sources of employment were the{brickworks}at Calvert and agriculture.The former remains a large employer but in{agriculture}there have been changes that are discussed elsewhere.There is some industry in the village but{none manufacturing a {product.}There are several firms employed in the{building trade}ranging from a large haulage firm:T.Taylor Ltd.to smaller roofing firms such as O.Weingart Ltd.Langston & Tasker,the local{coach company,}have about 15 vehicles used on regular contracts for local firms and schools.there has been a growth of{very small businesses,}one or two people working together and these range from printing to catering and appear quite successful,if never likely to grow very large.
